items.title: M.V.K. Agro Food Product IPO: Day 1 subscription status, GMP and other details
items.content: The  ₹65.88 crore initial public offering (IPO) of small and medium-sized enterprise M.V.K. Agro Food Product opened for subscription today, Thursday, February 29, 2024. The issue, which will close on Monday, March 4, has a price of  ₹120 per share.
items.contentSnippet: The  ₹65.88 crore initial public offering (IPO) of small and medium-sized enterprise M.V.K. Agro Food Product opened for subscription today, Thursday, February 29, 2024. The issue, which will close on Monday, March 4, has a price of  ₹120 per share.

items.title: Sunteck Realty investors seem to be in a wait-and-watch mode
items.content: Sunteck’s March quarter (Q4FY24) performance will decide if it is able to meet FY24 pre-sales or bookings guidance of  ₹2,000 crore. In the first nine months of FY24, it clocked  ₹1,237 crore pre-sales.
items.contentSnippet: Sunteck’s March quarter (Q4FY24) performance will decide if it is able to meet FY24 pre-sales or bookings guidance of  ₹2,000 crore. In the first nine months of FY24, it clocked  ₹1,237 crore pre-sales.

items.title: Better product mix, volume boost to shape Jindal Steel's earnings
items.content: Higher domestic sales in Q4, additional volumes from the tie-up with Rashtriya Ispat Nigam, and a foray into flat steel products at the recently commissioned hot-strip mill would aid profitability
items.contentSnippet: Higher domestic sales in Q4, additional volumes from the tie-up with Rashtriya Ispat Nigam, and a foray into flat steel products at the recently commissioned hot-strip mill would aid profitability

items.title: Potential for any re-rating delayed for Paytm, says UBS; still sees 25% upside in the stock – here's why
items.content: UBS believes that any potential for a re-rating of Paytm based on profitability improvement has been delayed. It has retained a 'neutral' call on the stock and reduced its target price to  ₹510 (from  ₹650 earlier). The new target indicates an over 25 percent upside.
items.contentSnippet: UBS believes that any potential for a re-rating of Paytm based on profitability improvement has been delayed. It has retained a 'neutral' call on the stock and reduced its target price to  ₹510 (from  ₹650 earlier). The new target indicates an over 25 percent upside.

items.title: Stock market today: Sensex, Nifty 50 end volatile session with minor gains; bank stocks drive uptick
items.content: Stock market today: Domestic equity indices Sensex and Nifty 50 closed higher on Thursday amid volatility and mixed global cues. Market recovered in the last hours despite starting flat. Monthly expiry led to persistent trade volatility.
items.contentSnippet: Stock market today: Domestic equity indices Sensex and Nifty 50 closed higher on Thursday amid volatility and mixed global cues. Market recovered in the last hours despite starting flat. Monthly expiry led to persistent trade volatility.

items.title: FMCG index down over 5% in 2024 YTD; will this negative trend continue?
items.content: The fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) sector has been one of the worst-performing sectors in the current calendar year so far. The Nifty FMCG index is down over 5 percent in 2024 YTD as against a 1 percent rise in benchmark Nifty. Will this negative trend continue in 2024?
items.contentSnippet: The fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) sector has been one of the worst-performing sectors in the current calendar year so far. The Nifty FMCG index is down over 5 percent in 2024 YTD as against a 1 percent rise in benchmark Nifty. Will this negative trend continue in 2024?

items.title: General Elections 2024: Investing before polls can be strategically advantageous, says Franklin Templeton
items.content: Assessing the impact of past elections, FT observed that the Indian market has consistently offered positive returns after elections, as seen in 2004 (16.1 percent), 2009 (38.7 percent) and 2014 (14.7 percent), over the one-year period following the election result date.
items.contentSnippet: Assessing the impact of past elections, FT observed that the Indian market has consistently offered positive returns after elections, as seen in 2004 (16.1 percent), 2009 (38.7 percent) and 2014 (14.7 percent), over the one-year period following the election result date.

items.content: Mukka Proteins IPO opens today and closes on March 4. Price band set at  ₹26 to  ₹28 per share with lot size of 535 shares. Reserved shares for QIB, NII, and retail investors as per SEBI guidelines. Mukka Proteins IPO worth  ₹224 crore comprises fresh issue of 8,00,00,000 equity shares.
